terms.english: Have you had a bowel movement?
I want to check your temperature.
I want to check your weight.
You have to drink lots of water.
I want you to walk with me.
terms.pronunciation: Abeek timshi ma'ai. (m) / Abeeki timsheen ma'ai. (f)
terms.arabic: أبيك تمشي معاي. (m) / أبيكِ تمشين معاي. (f)

terms.english: Does the pain wake you from sleep?
No, I didn't sleep well yesterday.
How long does the pain last?
From 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain), how much pain do you have?
terms.pronunciation: Min sifr (mafi alam) ila 'asharah (ashadd alam), kam al-alam?
terms.arabic: من صفر (مافي ألم) إلى عشرة (أشد ألم)، كم الألم؟

terms.english: Do you want a painkiller now?
After the painkiller, is it better?
Please lift your right / left hand / leg.
terms.pronunciation: Irfa' yadak al-yameen / al-yasar. / Irfa' rijlak...
terms.arabic: ارفع يدك اليمين / اليسار. / ارفع رجلك...

terms.english: Follow my finger with your eyes.
I need to listen to your heart.
I need to check your blood pressure.
Do you have high blood pressure?
What time do you usually eat?
Do you drink milk every day?

terms.pronunciation: Eish ismak? (to a male) / Eish ismik? (to a female)

terms.english: I need to check your vital signs
You have a fever, your temp is 38
I’m allergic to shrimp and penicillin
Yes, I have diabetes and high BP
How many children do you have?
What did you say? (to a male)
What did you say? (to a female)
What’s your name please? (to a male)
What’s your name please? (to a female)
Where are you from? (to a male)
Where are you from? (to a female)
I’m your nurse for the shift
Sure, I will bring it in 30 mins
Press the call bell for assistance
Who do you want to speak to?
I will be back in 20 minutes
The doctor may arrive in an hour
I have never seen this before
How do I get to the gym?
How do I get to the office?
What's the best way to get to your house?
Go straight until you see the hospital, then turn left.
terms.pronunciation: Rooh seeda لين tishoof al-mustashfa, ba'dain liff yasar
terms.arabic: روح سيدة لين تشوف المستشفى، بعدين لف يسار

terms.english: Turn left when you see a roundabout.
Turn right at the end of the road, my house is number 67
terms.pronunciation: Fi nihayat ash-shari', liff yameen, bayti raqam 67
terms.arabic: في نهاية الشارع، لف يمين، بيتي رقم 67

terms.english: Take the third road on the right
Take the second road on the left
What do you want? (to a male)
What do you want? (to a female)
